A drawer is opened. Stella’s hand digs through the clutte expose -- a STRAIGHT RAZOR gleans under a mishmash of MAK Stella stares into the mirror. Her body is gaunt, almost skeletal. A sadness in her eyes.

(annoyed at Chuck) Dude. Chuck realizes his poor choice of words and backpedals --
I’m... sorry. I didn’t -- Stella goes solemn, but shirks it off.
It’s fine. Gimme that -- Stella grabs the joint. Before she takes a drag -- OS eng of a ‘68 Bonneville.

(lowers clown mask) Cover your face, stupid. And hold out the bait. Chuck dons his disguise, acting as if this were some kind heist. INSIDE ‘68 BONNEVILLE Kurt laughs with his kind, throwing beer cans out the win IN THE BACKSEAT -- Alice is all done up for her date, wed between two Lettermans. She swats their unwanted advances
(to Kurt, annoyed) You said we would have dinner. Kurt’s eyes narrow as he spots the backs of some trick-or treaters all alone.

How ‘bout dessert? He hits the gas. His FLATTOP buddy cackles and leans out passenger window, prepping to snare the candy bag -- As they blow past, he RIPS the bag from Chuck’s hand. The all laugh. Flattop opens the pillowcase only to find --

They hold their ground, not afraid to exhaust every bit o their stash. Payback for years of being picked on. Chuck proudly lights his BROWN PAPER BAG OF SHIT on fire.

And now for the Poup D’etat... As the Bonneville returns for a second pass, Chuck TOSSES - throwing it right into their window. INSIDE ‘68 BONNEVILLE The bag EXPLODES on Kurt’s lap. Alice SHRIEKS. He frantic swats the flames and manure, forgetting to hit the brakes The Bonneville surges backward, out of control --
The brakes! The brakes!
They beam in victory -- -- Only to see the Bonneville CRASH into a tree. Their sm drop, suddenly concerned by the inevitable fallout.

Let’s cheese it! As they are running away -- ON CRASHED ‘68 BONNEVILLE Shit-stained Kurt and his cronies pile out of the car. Al sees her four-armed brother running away.

text: Your sister went out with that dickhead?

Chuck sees the heat is on him and silently curses, all fo arms pumping in stride. He heads for the woods.
Run into the woods, searching in all directions. Flattop finds -- The SPIDER MAN COSTUME. They fan out.

A DRIVE-IN nestled in a natural basin on the waterfront. line of 60-era cars waiting to get inside.
Chuck meets Stella and Auggie, ducking behind cars, tryin stay undetected by the Lettermans scanning the area.  11. They hide behind a CORVAIR MONZA, blaring “Little Green Apples”
You're in your underwear.

THE STARING, GRINNING FACE of a dead woman!! In gory technicolor. A smattering of cars idly face a towering outdoor screen showing the horror flick. Pipe organ swells through every hanging CAR WINDOW SPEAKER, as the small audience scarf popcorn or take part in the usual immoral behavior.
As Ramén watches the movie -- Chuck climbs out of the retractable back seat, putting on an oversized military t

Have at it. Stella and Auggie pull themselves out, adrenaline still pumping through their veins.
That was amazing.  12.
Did’ju see the look on their faces?

«.. I’m a Pierrot. Stella pulls herself into the passenger seat. Wiping her paint off.
Thanks. We owe you. (re: movie) Black Sabbath... a good one. Mario Bava- he’s real good-

(Vincent Price impression) “Men sometimes have strange motives for the things they do.” Ram6én smiles upon meeting a kindred spirit.
Ramén. Stella blushes, then turns her attention to the movie, pushing up her glasses to see better. Ramén feels dissed.
Her name is Stella. I’m Chuck, and this is Auggie. Stella sees the name ‘Morales’ on Chuck’s military attire

Not all of them...
Forgive her. She’s strange. Chuck sees something out the window and ducks -
Dick Breath alert. He’s coming in.

The banged-up Bonneville pulls into the drive-in. Kurt ge out and talks to a few Lettermans, motioning to the vicin Alice is offered a bucket of popcorn, but from her crosse arms, she clearly doesn’t want anything to do with this. They spread out to widen the search, peeking into cars.
As Kurt and the Lettermans get closer --
Back in the trunk. Stella and Chuck are quick to take refuge but Auggie revo

(handing over blanket) It’s your hide. Auggie hides under a blanket as the others go into the tr
Get your hand off my butt. I can’t control them.
Ssh.  14. They quiet down and Ramén plays it cool. As they wait for Kurt to search the neighboring cars --
(discrete to Auggie) What’s up with weirdo bird? Auggie peeks out from under the blanket, keeping his voic low and his sentences short.

Who, Stella? (beat) Her family moved here about ten years ago. Not long after, her mom was killed. She doesn’t like to talk about it, but everyone pretty much knows it was her dad that did it- Ramén looks shocked. Auggie back peddles --

He didn’t kill her- Not on like purpose. He was drunk. And driving. He swears it was someone else but no one really buys it. Not even Stell. This sits with Ramén. He looks at the trunk through the r view mirror, suddenly empathetic. -- A RAP on the window startles them. Auggie hides. Ramén cranks down his window to see Kurt leering in.
Soda and popcorn. Extra butter.
(sneers, then) You wouldn’t happen to have seen a spider, a clown, or a skinny bitch? Auggie sees his clown shoes are peeking out. He tries to cover them but the blanket is too short.

Now that you mention it... no. But you'll be the first to know. Kurt checks out Ramén’s car and laughs, knowing full well he’s being played. Behind him --  15. Lettermans gather, ready at his beckon call. Kurt motions them to hold off - he can handle it.

You got a smart mouth, Amigo. I’1l let that slide. Besides -- (cutting to the bone) I feel bad for any war hero who has a hood for a son. Ramén grips the wheel, restraining his better instinct. KURT (CONT’D) (spots clown shoes) I see you, shit stain! Get outta the car! I bet that drunk’s girl is in there too!
Mind keeping it down? Everyone's trying to watch a movie.
So you won’t get outta the car. See that, fellas? Mexicans aren't brown, they're yellow. Ram6én glances to see what he’s up against. It must be 5 He stays seated, knowing the smart play.

Ramén pulls out of the Drive-In. Stella and her friends g settled into their seats.

I’m sorry I missed whatever you did to piss off that ape. (beat) You may wanna hold off going home. I take it he knows where you live?

(giddy ) He doesn’t know. Ramén looks to Stella, hoping she will clear it up.
Ever wanted to check out a haunted house?... Hang a left. Off Ramén’s growing curiosity, he takes the next turn.
The Corvair Monza parks on a secluded dirt road. The gras has grown long. Years of neglect, or perhaps avoidance.

(gazes out window) You really weren’t kidding... They step out of the car to see -- An unbuilt portion of a RAISED FREEWAY. A fractured monol of jagged rebar and cement. You coming? Intrigued, Ramén shuts his door and follows their lead.
So who are the Bellows?
Some railway magnate who put Mill Valley on the map.

It was just a settlement until they dammed the river, allowing this place to flourish. My mom says they were a pretty big deal back then. They pass a FAMILY PLOT. Every single tombstone marks a d in 1921. Ramén double checks to see if he saw that right, then races to catch up with the others.
Lemme guess - something horrible happened to them in 1921? Stella and Ramén join Auggie onto the front porch where C BRICKS and WIRE line the house.

-- Through the foyer and up the bannister stairs. The front door creaks open, welcoming Stella and Ramén in with the moonlight. They take in the surroundings with reserved wonderment and caution -- What once was a luxurious mansion has now been picked cle of any valuables and defaced over time: Torn, water-stain wallpaper. Missing floorboards. Broken and strewn article litter a floor already covered in layers of dust.
So what happened to the Bellows? Stella runs her fingers down the wallpaper as she passes the halls, transfixed. Ramén hangs on her every word.

They had a young daughter they never let out of the house. Sarah. As the story goes, they never allowed pictures of her either. Ram6én passes a PHOTOGRAPH of the BELLOWS FAMILY still hu the wall: A gaunt patriarch and matriarch with a thick gr ribbon around her neck, surrounded by sturdy young men.

Like, she didn’t look right. Had scoliosis and gigantism- or something. She was long and tall and sort of not right. But she had this gift, see? A milkman once said he saw her bring a dead rabbit back to life. (MORE )
She could touch a dead flower and make it bloom- But that’s just the town’s usual gossip.
Nothing usual about that.
A car with LETTERMANS drive down the vacant road, passing Bellows front gates... and spot the parked CORVAIR MONZA. They share a grin, then speed off.
Auggie reluctantly walks the halls in search of Chuck.

Chuck?... Chuck? He finds a tear in the wallpaper, then takes pleasure in PEELING it for as long as he can, exposing rotted panelin An INTRUSION of COCKROACHES squeeze through an exposed cr Disgusted, he delicately tucks the wallpaper back.

No one knows. But a year later, in 1921, every member of her family died from bizarre and unexplained deaths. (beat) Some think it was the ghosts of the murdered children, others think it was Sarah herself, come back to punish her family for locking her up.
